charity.name: Macmillan Cancer Support
eventName: Jackie's 100K Jaunt in 31 days (May) Round Rainham for Macmillan Cancer Support
story:
We all know someone who has had cancer or lost somebody to this horrible disease.

I started the beginning of the first lockdown not be able to, or even wanting to run, but it seemed the only thing to do as all gyms were shut so I started the Couch to 5K, running for just minute intervals at the beginning - nearly killed me.  I am now running 5K regularly and sometimes a bit more - slowly - but I'm doing it,

Fund raising has been difficult this with the pandemic so I wanted to put my new running "hobby" to good use.  I aim to run 100K in the month of May (because May has 31 days!!!) to raise money for Macmillan Cancer Support, anything you can donate will be fantastic and I will log my progress daily.

If you want to add a personal message to a loved one or lost one on my page please feel free.

These are just a few of my friends and family who have been affected:

Margaret Mercer, Linzi Carruthers, Anne Bailey, Sandra Taylor, Nicola Gray, Nicola Newton, June Turvey, Nicky Prior, Viv Parlane, Dave Maynard, Lisa Mahoney, Lorraine Goodall, Barry Gore.
title: 100K Jaunt in 31 days (May) for Macmillan Cancer Support
pageSummary: I am running 100k in May because 1 in 3 people are affected by cancer!!
pageSummaryWhy: 1 in 3 people are affected by cancer!!

eventName: In memory of Ruby Anne FEWELL
story: My late wife Ruby Anne Fewell sadly passed away on 14th February 2021. We were married and together for 50 years.   She was looked after by myself at home together with Carers, District nurses and McMillian nurses. Her wish was no flowers at her funeral as flowers were for the living. As such anyone who was going to give flowers I would greatly appreciate donating to just giving and McMillian nurses.

charity.name: Macmillan Cancer Support
story:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

This year I will be taking part in events and doing my best to raise funds for Macmillan Cancer Support.  My friends and family have helped to raise over £19,200 so far, thank you.  But the work doesn't end and they still need us to do our bit, however big or small it would be wonderful if you could help once again.

I'll be running 26.2 Miles in the Yorkshire Marathon on Sunday 17th October 2021. 

I'm raising funds in memory of my big brother Matt who sadly lost his short battle with cancer in 2018.  Macmillan were there to help him and support the family with good advice.  Please help to ensure they are there for other families too.

Donating through JustGiving is simple, fast and totally secure. Your details are safe with JustGiving - they'll never sell them on or send unwanted emails. Once you donate, they'll send your money directly to the charity. So it's the most efficient way to donate - saving time and cutting costs for the charity.

charity.name: Macmillan Cancer Support
story:
Hi, my name is Hannah and if you know me, you know I despise running but this is for such a good cause I couldn't really say no. I'll be running 61 miles in april for the equivalent years of my mums age, 61. (Don't tell her I told you that). 

Over the last few months my mum has been diagnosed with stomach cancer stage 3 and has been going through the first stages of chemo therapy. As a family this hit us hard, especially with the lockdown and not being able to be present physically but she's been so strong and positive in processing the news and motivating herself to fight it. 

If I can raise any money at all for Macmillan that will be a bonus. This challenge is nothing compared to the work you're doing fighting this fight mum. Proud of you everyday 💪


Thanks for supporting my fundraising. At Macmillan, we give people with cancer everything we’ve got. If you’re diagnosed, your worries are our worries. We’re doing whatever it takes. But without your help we can’t support everyone who needs us.Donating through JustGiving is simple, fast and secure. Your details are safe with JustGiving - they'll never sell them or send unwanted emails. Once you donate, they'll send your money directly to the charity. So it's the most efficient way to donate - saving time and cutting costs.

story:
Thanks for supporting our fundraising. At our Toolstation branch in Fareham Segensworth, we walk a lot each day to meet our customers needs, but how can we actually walk?!? 

Our Challenge is to walk 10,000 miles between Easter and Halloween cumulatively amongst the team in our store, during our working day. We will be wearing pedometers and step counters to measure our progress, and for reference, Sydney is 10600 miles from Fareham, Hampshire!

We would love your support and any donations to assist the fantastic work that Macmillan do.

eventName: John Brave The Shave, Toolstation Tonbridge
story:
1 in 2 people will be diagnosed with Cancer at some point in their life, this takes a toll on them, their friends and their family. Recently I have had friends and Family battle Cancer first hand and not all of them are with us today. I've seen the journey that they have had to take and would like to do my part to help them.

I Will Be Dying my Hair green on St Patrick's Day in support Of Macmillan and will be keeping it green for the rest of March. Once April is here I will be Braving the Shave On Easter Sunday. Any Donation  will be greatly Appreciated.

Toolstation are proud to be partnering with Macmillan Cancer Support for the next two years.There are currently 3 million people living with cancer in the UK, with someone receiving a cancer diagnosis every two minutes. We know that one in two people in the UK will experience a cancer diagnosis in their lifetime.For more than 100 years Macmillan has been there for people with cancer when they needed them most. Today is no exception!Cancer is not going anywhere. And neither can Macmillan.Join us in supporting Macmillan, so they can keep providing physical, financial and emotional support to the millions of people that count on them.
title: Johnathan's Brave The Shave, Toolstation Tonbridge

eventName: London to Brighton Off-Road Bike Ride 2021
story:
Hi all!
Adam here!
I’ve decided to take on the challenge of taking part in the British Heart Foundation’s 74 mile off road bike ride from London to Brighton, taking place in September 2021.

It’s going to be an exciting challenge, all for a great cause. The British Heart Foundation have really struggled this past year as COVID has prevented fundraising events from taking place. I’d love if you could support me, and the great work of the BHF by donating. Anything you can give will help to make a massive difference!

All the best

Adam

charity.name: British Heart Foundation
story:
Hi all, 

Thanks for visiting my page. After a few whiskeys, I was dared to let my lockdown hair continue to grow for a whole year! 

Those who know me will be aware of how particular I am about my ‘public image’

I agreed to do this if I can raise money for the British Heart Foundation. 

Pardon the pun, but this is a charity very close to my heart. They have looked after me & my late mum, who I sadly lost in December, and countless others in so many ways. 

I would love you to support me in this to raise some money for the BHF. I will provide monthly updates & exclusive photos of the hair progress! 

I have a target of £2000 - steep, but I’m prepared for you all to have a go at styling my hair as you please! (No scissors or hair dye!) 

All donations are tax deductible- no excuse cabbies!!

Thanks for your support. Adrian 👍
title: Adrian's - Hair Today, Not Gone Tomorrow
pageSummary: No haircut until 1/3/22 = public image ruined because they have saved me, my mum and countless others

charity.description: With your support, we aim to fund over £100 million of research each year into all heart and circulatory diseases and the things that cause them. Heart diseases. Stroke. Vascular dementia. Diabetes. They're all connected, and they're all under our microscope. Together we can beat heartbreak forever.
charity.name: British Heart Foundation
story:
The pandemic is the biggest challenge we've faced in our 60 year history. And it's led to us being forced to make the devastating decision to cut our 2020 research budget in half. So the truth is, we've never needed people like you more. 

Virtual fundraising challenges like Dechox are a way to help us keep up the pace of progress. Your willpower will be funnelled into ground-breaking science and support for the people who need us most.

Because despite everything else happening at the moment, heart and circulatory diseases are still the world's biggest killers. For the sake of our mums and dads, brothers and sisters, grandparents and friends - we can't drop the ball now.

charity.name: British Heart Foundation
story:
The pandemic is the biggest challenge we've faced in our 60 year history. And it's led to us being forced to make the devastating decision to cut our 2020 research budget in half. So the truth is, we've never needed people like you more. 

Virtual fundraising challenges like Dechox are a way to help us keep up the pace of progress. Your willpower will be funnelled into ground-breaking science and support for the people who need us most.

Because despite everything else happening at the moment, heart and circulatory diseases are still the world's biggest killers. For the sake of our mums and dads, brothers and sisters, grandparents and friends - we can't drop the ball now.

charity.description: With your support, we aim to fund over £100 million of research each year into all heart and circulatory diseases and the things that cause them. Heart diseases. Stroke. Vascular dementia. Diabetes. They're all connected, and they're all under our microscope. Together we can beat heartbreak forever.

charity.description: The ability to get around is vital in order to live a full life yet thousands of people with sight loss never leave home alone. We empower visually impaired people to do that and rely on the support of the public to fund the guide dog service.
charity.name: Guide Dogs
charity.registrationNumber: in England and Wales 209617 and Scotland SC038979
story: We're taking part in the sponsored walk that's good for the "sole" this May! As we walk we will be raising vital funds for Guide Dogs to help those with sight loss step out with confidence. The sponsorship money you help us raise really will make a difference. Just £140 could buy a Starter Kit for a new guide dog owner, containing everything they need to start a life with their new guide dog, this includes the iconic white harness. Go on knock our socks off!
title: We're walking our socks off for Guide Dogs!
image.caption: Walk your Socks off banner
media.images.image.caption: Walk your Socks off banner
rememberedPersonSummary.name: NA

charity.description: The ability to get around is vital in order to live a full life yet thousands of people with sight loss never leave home alone. We empower visually impaired people to do that and rely on the support of the public to fund the guide dog service.
charity.name: Guide Dogs
charity.registrationNumber: in England and Wales 209617 and Scotland SC038979
story:
In the UK today, almost two million people are living with sight loss and of those, around 180,000 rarely leave their homes alone. Many suffer from depression and struggle with feelings of isolation. 

Guide Dogs is here to help solve this problem. We provide individual support that overcomes the emotional and physical challenges faced by people living with sight loss. 

We work for a world where people with sight loss are never left out of life. We work for a world where blind people no longer feel invisible, where the quality of their eye sight is genuinely the only difference between them and the rest of society. 

A world with enough support to make the challenges of sight loss no barrier to fulfilling your needs and dreams. A world where being blind or partially sighted isn't what defines you.

charity.name: Great Ormond Street Hospital Children's Charity
story:
Husband to Sue.

Father to Sienna and Scott.

Mandad to Isaac, Alfie and Sunny.

Friend to so many.


Orrett, aka Oz, aka Bruce, aka the Captain, and many more!
First and foremost a devoted family man, a devoted and besotted Mandad, so very happy with his world. So full of life, energy and fun, and quite a few cheeky jokes and one liners. Someone you always want in your team, whatever the day, whatever the event. Professional, efficient and all round great guy. Taken away when he still had so much to see, to do, to live and to love. Much missed. Rest in peace Oz xx

charity.description: Marie Curie provides care and support for people living with any terminal illness across the UK. Our nurses work night and day in people’s homes and our hospices offer specialist care. We also support people emotionally, provide practical information, and match them with trained volunteers.
charity.name: Marie Curie
story:
Kirsty's dad Les, died last August from bowel cancer. He was cared for by Marie Curie in his final months and Kirsty said, the hospice gave us our dad back.

When dad was first diagnosed, I felt like my insides had been ripped out, it was a real gut-wrenching moment. He was a single parent and brought us up on his own, so we were all really close. Dad was a really active, sociable man and never viewed himself as an elderly person. When Marie Curie was first mentioned dad wasn't keen and I must admit I also thought that's where you go to die. But he was there for about four weeks and I can honestly say Marie Curie gave us our dad back. That was just the best thing ever - he had no distress and we knew they were taking such good care of him.
The nurses said they would let me know when they felt dad was close to the end so I could stay with him and I ended up self-isolating with him at the hospice for the last week of his life. That meant the world to me. I feel very privileged that I had

charity.description: Marie Curie provides care and support for people living with any terminal illness across the UK. Our nurses work night and day in people’s homes and our hospices offer specialist care. We also support people emotionally, provide practical information, and match them with trained volunteers.
charity.name: Marie Curie
story:
The Marie Curie Bradford Hospice supports people living with a terminal illness and those closest to them to live as well as possible.  

The Hospice is often very different from what people expect  it is a warm, friendly space with beautiful gardens, delicious home-cooked food and personalised care. Every person is treated as an individual and helped to reach their goals and fulfil their wishes. A team of nurses, doctors, social workers, physiotherapists, chaplains, bereavement counsellors and pharmacists work together, putting every person at the centre of their care.  

Throughout Covid-19 Bradford Hospice teams have been working around the clock to continue supporting local people. Death, dying and bereavement is at the forefront of peoples minds and Marie Curie knows what a difference the right care at the end of life can make.  
 
They cant do any of this without your support. Thank you for your generous donation which supports the Bradford Hospice and Marie Curie care

charity.description: Marie Curie provides care and support for people living with any terminal illness across the UK. Our nurses work night and day in people’s homes and our hospices offer specialist care. We also support people emotionally, provide practical information, and match them with trained volunteers.
charity.name: Marie Curie
story:
Every day of your life matters from the first to the last. We believe that everyone living with a terminal illness should be able to get the most from the time they have left, however hard that may sometimes feel.
We'll be here for you and your family when you may feel like no-one else is, to help you cope when you don't know how. Marie Curie Nurses care for you in your home, when you need them most, day or night. Our hospices are at the heart of communities around the UK. And our trained volunteers and advisers are here for you with practical information and support when you don't know what to do next or just need to talk.
We'll be by your side with care and support every step of the way, bringing light in the darkest hours.

charity.description: RNLI volunteer lifeboat crews provide a 24-hour search and rescue service all around the UK and Ireland, while lifeguards keep a careful watch on the UK’s busiest beaches. RNLI lifesaving and drowning prevention depend on supporter fundraising and the generous donations that you and others give.
charity.name: RNLI - Royal National Lifeboat Institution
story:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page. 

My plan is to walk the entire length of hadrians wall end to end with a full backpack which will be heavy!!! Due to legal reasons i cant do the entire thing in one go i will need to exit the trail to camp at night but i shall be starting the following day from the exact same point at which i left the trail it takes 8 days roughly i shall do my best to get under the 8 days. 

I am doing this in memory of my amazing nana who sadly passed away. The reason i have chosen the RNLI is because she done alot for the organisation and i thought it would be fitting to her legacy. 

My target is 500 but it would mean so much more if i could get over that target. 

Due to covid 19 restrictions i cant set an exact date on when i shall do the challenge but as soon as i know i shall update this page so everyone can track the process this is just the first stage to start fundraising and there will be more updates soon. 

Thanks for reading

 Anthony Cockrell

charity.description: RNLI volunteer lifeboat crews provide a 24-hour search and rescue service all around the UK and Ireland, while lifeguards keep a careful watch on the UK’s busiest beaches. RNLI lifesaving and drowning prevention depend on supporter fundraising and the generous donations that you and others give.
charity.name: RNLI - Royal National Lifeboat Institution
eventName: Kayaking from Ullswater to Silith Down the eamont and Eden Rivers
story:
The RNLI has been operating at full capacity since the start of lockdown. Our service has been rescuing people throughout the Coronavirus pandemic and our heroic crews commitment to saving lives has not stopped. Unfortunately, our ability to raise funds has been limited.The average lifeboat station in the North West costs £136,000 a year to run and we are going to have a significant shortfall in income due to the Coronavirus. We are asking all our friends and communities to donate what they can to keep us running.All along the North West coast from Silloth to West Kirby, we will always be there to keep you and your loved ones safe, on our watch, there will be no preventable deaths on the North West coast. Please help us fulfil that mission.

This is a great Charity and God Forbid, If anything was to befall you or your family out at sea, You would be iternally greatful to the service these good people provide out of the goodness of there hearts and through this charity alone. They risk their own Lives for YOU!! And thats vollentry. 

Please give generoustly on this Just giving site, or on our sponsor forms. 

Our sponsor for the event is the award winning "Hillcroft Holliday Village" at Ullswater, and the boats are all being donated for use on the event date from "Go Wild Boat Hire" within Hillcroft Holiday village.

A great big Thank you from the top of our hearts for sponsering us.
title: Nigel's Kayaking from Ullswater to Silith Down the eamont and Eden Rivers
image.caption: NA
media.images.image.caption: NA

charity.description:
We’re the world’s leading independent conservation organisation. And we’re building a future where people and nature thrive together. 

That’s why we’re passionate about sharing the planet’s resources more sustainably, tackling climate change and protecting endangered wildlife.
charity.name: WWF-UK
story:
I am trying to raise money for polar bears in the wild. They are dying because of global warming and some get stranded on ice in the sea because of the polar ice caps melting. I am doing a 20km bike ride on the 21st of March 2021 to raise money for the WWF to help protect them. I would be really grateful for any donations towards saving these animals.

Thank you
Isobelle Xx

----------------------------------------------------

WWF is at the heart of global efforts to address the world’s most important environmental challenges: safeguarding the natural world, tackling climate change and enabling people to use only their fair share of natural resources. Together we can build a future where people and nature thrive. Your support is much appreciated. Find out more by visiting wwf.org.uk

charity.description: Oxfam is a global movement of people who won’t live with the injustice of poverty. Together we save lives in disasters. We help people build better lives for themselves. We speak out on the big issues, like inequality and climate change. And we won’t stop until we end poverty for everyone. Join us
charity.name: Oxfam
story:
Hello, 

Both of my Grans, Molly and Doreen, volunteered for many years at Oxfam in Stowmarket, and I would like to run in memory of them both. Grandma Molly was volunteer manager for 24 years and was awarded a long service award for 30 years service. Grandma Doreen volunteered for many years at Oxfam.                                                          

Oxfam is a charity that has always stayed within my heart and I would like to do something small to contribute to their amazing works that has helped to reduce global poverty. 

Running a marathon has been a personal goal of mine and I have always enjoy challenging myself. I would like to thank anyone for support and donations to help me complete this challenge. 

Stay safe and much love,

Hannah 

xx

Thanks for taking the time to visit our JustGiving page.

We are Tammy, Amy and Ruth and we love to train and complete challenges together whilst raising important funds for some amazing charities. 

For the Trailwalker 2021 we will be walking a massive 100km non-stop within 30 hours across the South Downs starting in Queen Elizabeth country park near Portsmouth and finishing at Brighton Racecourse.  

The Trailwalker event is hosted by and raising much needed funds for Oxfam and any donations will be gratefully received.

charity.name: Unicef UK
story:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

I’ve been clearing glass, plastic and junk from areas in nature for many years and right now I want to channel that into a sponsored cleanup for the crisis happening currently in Yemen. 

I’ll be clearing an estimated 50 bags of rubbish from woodlands, rivers, parks and beaches. I’m trained in health and safety and will do this safely and considerately, using the right equipment.

It’s a great way to spend some weekends and free time during lockdown, and beyond!

Thank you for any contributions for Yemen

charity.description: Médecins Sans Frontières / Doctors Without Borders (MSF) is the world's leading medical humanitarian aid organisation. We work in over 70 countries - in conflict zones, natural disasters and epidemics. We are independent, neutral and impartial. We provide medical care where it's needed most.
charity.name: Medecins Sans Frontieres / Doctors Without Borders (MSF)
story: WeCare Foundation, is a charitable foundation dedicated to helping those in need. Founded by Ibrahim Khurshid and Ahmed Khan during the toughest time of this century, we strive to create change for the better With the dedication of our volunteers, staff members, and partners, we strive to improve the lives of everyone who needs help and has no one to rely on. We here at WeCare Foundation believe that we can all gift someone a life, especially now during such an economically, socially and mentally intense period of time; let's support each other and build the future together. Start today, start now; help isn't just donating, its also raising awareness for rising issues such those which we help solve. When you contribute towards our causes, you contribute towards a better tomorrow.

charity.description: WaterAid is an international not-for-profit, determined to make clean water, decent toilets and good hygiene normal for everyone, everywhere within a generation. Only by tackling these three essentials in ways that last can people change their lives for good.
charity.name: WaterAid
story:
"Remember to keep washing your hands (ideally for 20 seconds)" a very relevant and close to home statement we hear every day. Such a simple task which we definitely take for granted.

Clean water and sanitation is a basic human right. Shockingly, 1 in 10 people worldwide don't have access to clean water, putting them at risk of diseases. Especially now, during this pandemic, can you imagine what life would be like if we didn't have access to clean water, if we had to walk miles to wash our hands and then the water isn't even clean? This is the reality for 785 million people but not just to wash their hands... Some children not being able to attend school because water is the priority. Cleaner, decent toilets and good hygiene should be a normal part of everyone’s daily life. Without all three, people can’t live dignified, healthy lives. With all three, they can unlock their potential, break free from poverty and change their lives for good.

I believe clean water and sanitation is a basic human right we should all have access to. To help, even ever so slightly, I want to raise money for the people who do not have the clean water they deserve. I hope you can all support me.
